Question:
What are the main differences between the  General PWM Timer (GPT) and the Asynchronous General Purpose Timer (AGT).
Answer:
AGT: The AGT timers are 16-bit timers.
GPT: All RA MCUs have at least one 32-bit GPT timer.
AGT: The AGT runs off PCLKB, LOCO, or subclock.
GPT: The GPT runs off PCLKD with a configurable divider up to 1024.
GPT: The GPT can be configured to count ELC events or external pulses.
AGT: The AGT can operate in all low power modes. It is located in the Vbatt domain and can operate from Vbatt.
GPT: The GPT can operate in sleep mode.
  Suitable Products
RA
